item.title: Use GitLab to do .NET 4.8 CI/CD
item.description: Remind This is for .NET 4.8 or below only!! Precondition You already have a GitLab (GitLab Saas or GitLab self managed). This document is for .NET 4.X, if you want to build .NET core or .NET 5/6/7/..., you can use docker to run GitLab Runner. Procedure Step 1 - Prepare .NET build environment First, you need to prepare an environment to build .NET application. The easiest solution is to install Visual Studio.

item.title: GitLab Checkmarx CI/CD Integration
item.description: Purpose Checkmarx is a good tool to do code analysis, but it takes lots of time to do scan. If you need to download the code from Git and upload it to Checkmarx, it will take lots of time. What we want is, when we commit code to GitLab, we want GitLab sends the code to Checkmarx to scan. (the next step is to integrate the scan result to SonarQube)

item.title: GitLab Checkmarx SonarQube Integration
item.description: Purpose When we commit code to GitLab, we want GitLab to trigger these actions automatically: GitLab sends the code to Checkmarx to scan. GitLab triggers SonarQube to sacn. SonarQube integrate Checkmarx's report. Procedure You can reference the official document: https://checkmarx.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SD/pages/169246832/SonarQube+Plugin+v8.5.0+and+up Download the plugin from here, it only supports SonarQube LTS version (for now, it's 8.x) Configurea Quality Gate/Profiles of SonarQube for Checkmarx's rules. Use GitLab to trigger Checkmarx scan and record the project name of Checkmarx.
